f04df1f5-159a-4900-a0cb-6bed570348a1.description: Earners of the assessment-based credential, Facility Management Professional (FMP®), demonstrate a proven comprehension of the foundation core competencies of facility management and build practical skills that can apply to their jobs immediately resulting in cost-savings to their organization. The average five-year "return on investment" of an IFMA Credential is 15:1. This is a Lifetime Badge.
f04df1f5-159a-4900-a0cb-6bed570348a1.name: Facility Management Professional (FMP®)

alignments.name: American National Standards Institute (ANSI) under ANSI/ASTM E2659-18
alignments.description: IFMA is an ANSI-Accredited Certificate Issuer - Accreditation #1057. IFMA is accredited to issue the FMP Certificate to those successfully completing the FMP Certificate Program by the American National Standards Institute (ANSI) under ANSI/ASTM E2659-18.

badge_template_activities.title: There are no specific educational or experiential prerequisites required to take the FMP program and assessments.

Purchase and complete the IFMA FMP Credential Program, an all–inclusive training and assessment program that combines comprehensive reading materials, interactive online study tools to test your understanding and retention.
Complete the four online FMP final assessments with the stated passing score.
Submit your FMP application (with application fee) to IFMA to validate your FMP credential.

f666a743-e6d1-4c34-9689-dfa8a8a1756d.description: Earners of the globally recognized Certified Facility Manager® (CFM®), have demonstrated expertise in the field of facility management (FM) by meeting the required criteria of work experience, education and the ability to pass a comprehensive exam that covers 11 competencies that make up the FM body of knowledge. The CFM credential sets the industry standard for ensuring the knowledge and competence of practicing facility managers.
f666a743-e6d1-4c34-9689-dfa8a8a1756d.name: Certified Facility Manager® (CFM®)

badge_template_activities.title: Meet required criteria of five (5) years of (FM) experience or a degree in FM and three (3) years of experience.
Submit an application and fee.
Schedule the exam at a Prometric Testing Center and pass the four-hour exam consisting of questions on the 11 FM competencies.

skills.name: Facility Information Management And Technology Management

c978a99c-b935-457e-b305-b16d7807afd8.description: Earners of the assessment-based credential, Sustainability Facility Professional (SFP®), have demonstrated expertise in sustainable FM practices. The SFP credential and training program integrate the new and developing areas of energy, resource management, and improvements to the work environment into the world of the facility manager—the stewards of the workplace. This is a Lifetime badge.
c978a99c-b935-457e-b305-b16d7807afd8.name: Sustainability Facility Professional (SFP®)

alignments.name: American National Standards Institute (ANSI) under ANSI/ASTM E2659-18
alignments.description: IFMA is an ANSI-Accredited Certificate Issuer - Accreditation #1057. IFMA is accredited to issue the SFP Certificate to those successfully completing the SFP Certificate Program by the American National Standards Institute (ANSI) under ANSI/ASTM E2659-18.

badge_template_activities.title: There are no specific educational or experiential prerequisites; however, the SFP curriculum builds on a foundation of sound facility management knowledge. A solid understanding of FM practice is necessary for the candidate to fully comprehend and utilize the material in the program.

Purchase and complete the IFMA SFP Credential Program, an all–inclusive training and assessment program that combines comprehensive reading materials, interactive online study tools to test your understanding and retention.
Complete the three online SFP final assessments with a passing score of 75% or higher.
Submit your SFP application (with application fee) to IFMA to validate your SFP credential.

e9b7ad67-8851-4b42-b3df-d1ed4dec5213.description: As business leaders step up the corporate response to the sustainability agenda, facility managers are increasingly being asked to deliver support service that is broader and deeper than ever before. This is a lifetime badge; the earner also receives a certificate from IFMA upon successful completion of the final course assessment.
e9b7ad67-8851-4b42-b3df-d1ed4dec5213.name: IFMA's Sustainability Course

badge_template_activities.title: There are no specific educational or experiential prerequisites required to take IFMA's Sustainability Course.
Purchase and complete the course, which features all-inclusive training made up of eLearning modules, chapter quizzes, progress reports, and reading materials.

Chapter 1: Introduction to Sustainability, Chapter 2: Energy Management, Chapter 3: Water Management, Chapter 4: Materials and Consumable Management, Chapter 5: Waste Management, Chapter 6: Workplace and Site Management
Complete the final assessment to earn your certificate of completion.
Earners will be awarded Continuing Education Units (CEUs) 0.5 IACET.

ffb98800-31c0-4f7f-8cde-4e291e7c758d.description: Earners of the globally recognized FMG have graduated from an IFMA Foundation Facility Management Accredited Degree program. They have met the required academic standards as set forth by the Facility Management Accreditation Commission, covering 11 competencies that make up the FM body of knowledge. The FMG sets the standard for ensuring the knowledge and competence of facility managers.
ffb98800-31c0-4f7f-8cde-4e291e7c758d.name: Facility Management Graduate (FMG)

badge_template_activities.title: Graduate from an IFMA Foundation Facility Management Accredited Degree Program.
Meet the required criteria of graduation from a Facility Management Accredited Degree Program.
Submit an application for the FMG badge.

ac9b5055-6f4c-48bf-9688-f4a8778e4235.description: Those who hold IFMA's Real Estate badge have studied the interface between real estate decisions, facility management functions and the ability of the organization to achieve its goals. Upon successfully passing the final course assessment, IFMA will send the earner a certificate of completion.

e4df6f1b-b11e-4543-9ea0-34a5ea63903d.description: FMs need to be able to communicate effectively and efficiently with stakeholders and decision-makers, and IFMA’s Communication Course reviews the fundamental knowledge and skills an FM needs to effectively communicate. Upon successfully passing the final course assessment, IFMA will send the earner a certificate of completion.
e4df6f1b-b11e-4543-9ea0-34a5ea63903d.name: IFMA’s Communication Course

badge_template_activities.title: There are no specific educational or experiential prerequisites required to take IFMA’s Communication Course.
Purchase and complete the course, which features all-inclusive training made up of eLearning modules, chapter quizzes, progress reports, and reading materials.

Chapter 1 Business Communication Basics,  Chapter 2  Business Writing, Chapter 3 Written Business Communication to Achieve Results, Chapter 4 Conducting Effective Meetings, Chapter 5 Facility Management Communications Plan
Complete the final assessment to earn your certificate of completion.
Earners will be awarded Continuing Education Units (CEUs)  0.4 IACET.

cf5942f0-903f-455e-b480-c097ae67ff8f.description: With facility technology solutions evolving rapidly, IFMA’s Facility Information Management and Technology Management Course provides a starting point for FMs to understand secure, efficient data collection and support decision-making processes to meet core business objectives. Badge-earners also learn to assess tech needs and predict impact of new tech, as well as understand decision-making surrounding tech upkeep and replacement.
cf5942f0-903f-455e-b480-c097ae67ff8f.name: IFMA’s Facility Information Management and Technology Management Course

Purchase and complete the course, which features all-inclusive training made up of eLearning modules, chapter quizzes, progress reports and reading materials.

Chapter 1: Information Technology, FM, and the Organization, Chapter 2: Data Collection and Information Management, Chapter 3: IT & Security Basics for FM, Chapter 4: Computer-Aided Facility Management Systems (CAFM), Chapter 5: Tools and Concepts, Chapter 6: Assessment
Complete the final assessment to earn your certificate of completion.
Earners will be awarded Continuing Education Units (CEUs)  0.7 IACET.

702154d8-687b-4d07-af13-54146b2de32d.description: Occupant salaries and benefits comprise the largest cost component during the facility life cycle. When considered from this perspective, facility management (FM) practices that support the productivity of people, organizational effectiveness, and minimize risk and liability are critical to the success of the demand organization. Upon successfully passing the final course assessment, IFMA will send the earner a certificate of completion.
702154d8-687b-4d07-af13-54146b2de32d.name: IFMA’s Occupancy and Human Factors Course

badge_template_activities.title: There are no specific educational or experiential prerequisites required to take IFMA’s Occupancy and Human Factors Course.
Purchase and complete the course, which features all-inclusive training made up of eLearning modules, chapter quizzes, progress reports, and reading materials.
Chapter 1: The human factor in the Workplace, Chapter 2: Workplace Environment, Chapter 3: Occupant Services, Chapter 4: Creating a Safe and Secure Workplace
Complete the final assessment to earn your certificate of completion.
Earners will be awarded Continuing Education Units (CEUs) 0.5 IACET.

15a33589-4c96-42dc-a688-6f73e4f7fdf9.description: Risk management has become a critical component of strategic management. It is the way an organization can live with the uncomfortable reality of risk. The facility manager’s role in risk management is to understand the vulnerabilities of the organization’s structures and infrastructure and balance the critical nature of the demand organization’s mission and functions against the possible occurrence and impact of a risk event.
15a33589-4c96-42dc-a688-6f73e4f7fdf9.name: IFMA’s Risk Management Course

badge_template_activities.title: There are no specific educational or experiential prerequisites required to take IFMA’s Risk Management Course.
Purchase and complete the course, which features all-inclusive training made up of eLearning modules, chapter quizzes, progress reports, and reading materials.
Chapter 1: Risk and Risk Management, Chapter 2: Risk Management Planning, Chapter 3: Emergency Preparedness and Disaster Response and Recovery, Chapter 4: Business Continuity and Facility Resilience
Complete the final assessment to earn your certificate of completion.
Earners will be awarded Continuing Education Units (CEUs) 0.5 IACET.

225be8c3-b953-4d2d-a234-6660a9b9eafe.description: Many performance and quality management techniques and practices described in this course have been around for years. IFMA’s Performance and Quality Course brings them together to provide the badge-holder with a comprehensive toolbox specific to facility management. Through IFMA’s Performance and Quality Course, badge-holders develop a "systems thinking” perspective and have studied critical insights that apply to quality-related FM practices.
225be8c3-b953-4d2d-a234-6660a9b9eafe.name: IFMA’s Performance and Quality Course

badge_template_activities.title: There are no specific educational or experiential prerequisites required to take IFMA’s Performance and Quality Course.
Purchase and complete the course, which features all-inclusive training made up of eLearning modules, chapter quizzes, progress reports, and reading materials.

Chapter 1: Setting the Strategic Direction, Chapter 2:  Identifying Performance Improvement Opportunities, Chapter 3: Metrics, Chapter 4: Measuring and Monitoring, Chapter 5: Performance Reporting, Chapter 6: Facility Management Quality Fundamentals, Chapter 7: Quality Measures for the Facility Organization, Chapter 8: Quality Assessment for the Facility Management Services
Complete the final assessment to earn your certificate of completion
Earners will be awarded Continuing Education Units (CEUs) 0.8 IACET.

6e999e34-05f5-4340-897a-8fd50cee6f08.description: Earners of the Retired Certified Facility Manager(TM) (RCFM), are Certified Facility Managers® (CFM®) who have retired or who have otherwise left the FM profession, want to indicate past certification and show their relationship to the credential.
6e999e34-05f5-4340-897a-8fd50cee6f08.name: Retired Certified Facility Manager(TM) (RCFM)

badge_template_activities.title: The Retired CFM designation is specifically for those not intending to continue representing themselves as a CFM in the practice of FM.
CFMs wishing to change to a Retired CFM status must submit the RCFM application and fee within six (6) months of their CFM expiration date.
There is no recertification or maintenance required for the RCFM. The RCFM is not considered an active credential.

14bc13b1-ed66-473e-9b07-42bfef0106dd.description: The program is based on the Workplace Management Framework and considers Workplace a strategic asset. It is designed to enhance management skills, align strategies to business goals, deliver a unique workplace experience & strengthen cross-disciplinary leadership efforts. Students learn about increasing workforce effectiveness & improving business outcomes through the integrated management of people, technology & space. Completion of program requirements leads to a Certificate of Completion.
14bc13b1-ed66-473e-9b07-42bfef0106dd.name: Workplace Strategy and Leadership Program

badge_template_activities.title: Completion of Module 1: Introduction to Workplace Management. Students actively participate in Lectures and Workshop exercises to learn: 1) Why workplace experience is increasingly important to ‘C-Suite’ leaders in the quest to attract & retain talent, inspire and optimize workforce effectiveness. 2) How to gain competitive advantage through the Workplace Experience 3) How to align workplace to business strategy.

Completion of Module 2: The Art and Science of Change Management. Students actively participate in Lectures and Workshop exercises to learn: 1) What are the drivers of change in the workplace and the challenges of managing change/workplace transformation 2) Understand the challenges of change on human behavior 3) How to design a Change Program

Completion of Module 3: Capacity, Project and Risk Management. Students actively participate in Lectures and Workshop exercises to learn: 1) What levels of capacity and commitment to the physical/virtual workplace as well as the services and technologies needed to achieve the strategic purpose 2) How to identify what success looks like in terms of the workplace program 3) How to use continuity Planning to identify/analyze and balance risk-opportunity trade-offs.

Completion of Module 4: Performance, Improvement and Resource Management. Students actively participate in Lectures and Workshop exercises to learn: 1) How to define and measure what matters in terms of the workplace management framework 2) How to build a success culture and virtuous circle of improvement mindset 3) What resources are needed to deliver the desired workplace experience and how to manage/measure the use of assets and services.

Completion of Final Workshop: Students actively participate in Workshop lectures and case study exercises in order to present: 1) An organizationally aligned and integrated Workplace Strategy and Roadmap 2) How to develop a Workplace Experience that supports an organization’s people in contributing and achieving their best work everyday. 3) How to prepare an organization for change and the transition to new ways of working 4) Methods for Measuring, Monitoring and Celebrating Success

a9df0860-a6e0-4895-80d3-e9224046f3ec.description: In 2020, the IFMA Forty Under 40 award program told the incredible stories of FMs under 40 years old that stand out as influencers in the built environment community for their incredible commitment to the industry. The finalists/winners, all under the age of 40 as of Dec 31, 2020, were nominated by their peers in honor of their talents and achievements as they rise through the ranks of the profession.
a9df0860-a6e0-4895-80d3-e9224046f3ec.name: IFMA’s Forty Under 40

badge_template_activities.title: Must be currently working as a FM industry professional
Under the age of 40 as of 12/31/2020
Nominated by a supervisor or peer
Chosen by an international panel of judges who are also FM professionals
